similaranime.anime: Ano Hi Mita Hana no Namae o Bokutachi wa Mada Shiranai.

recommendations.recommendation: If this is the best the genre then I wouldn`t want to see the worst. Fuko arc pretty much runined it for me.

Comments for this anime should really be disabled and instead there should be a box telling you to go watch this immediately. This is far and away the best, in my humble opinion, romance, TRUE ROMANCE, anime out there. I`ll give you money to watch this - it`s that good. You`ll be left craving for more and you`ll definitely play the VN. I`d rate this a 9,5/10 - I`d slap a 10/10, but that implies perfection and nobody is perfect =P

Sweet. Lighthearted. Laughter. Tears. This anime has a fun and mellow feel to it, but surprisingly has the perfect, sad psychological touches that can really grab viewers. Also, the characters all seem to fit in their own way into the story. Clannad actually brings out different emotions from you, making it a great unique watch.
Full spectrum from drama to comedy - beautiful animation and op/ed theme
it`s funy
Another best story from Visual Art/Key and hi-quality animation work by KyoAni .
For every anime fan who loves romantic and drama anime . This anime is the best in this category that i have ever seen
A great heart felt story, guaranteed to move the soul.
I cryed lot with this serie same with Air. Then I saw Kanon and Angel Beats and realized that Key will never come with anything new and started little hesitate about their shows.
Depois de Kanon, este é obrigatório

Not your typical high school harem anime. I was hesitant to watch this at first, but was very pleasantly surprised. Clannad has a surprisingly good plot that handles some rather difficult topics. The comedy is hilarious and the drama is emotionally engaging. Most importantly, Clannad has awesome characters that you really start to care about. Great show.
[RECOMMENDED]
watchable...but why it always have to be the worst choice for the girl Oo... Tomoyo > ALL
truely a graet story that brings a tear to my eyes when ever i watch it.
Very nice new romantic anime. Nice story, characters, animation and above all else atmosphere.
An anime about life. Sometimes funny sometimes extremely sad. *warning-moe blobs
Great story, voice acting, and memorable characters. this is so far the only anime that made me shed tears EVER.

Clannad is a quite funny though moving show. Some characters have a whole story arc revolving around them, as in many harem animes, but the harem component is quite secondary in this show, in my opinion. The storylines is from times to times a bit obvious, but still the show is entertaining and little by little you get to care for the main two characters.I only recommend this season, but the second season, Clannad ~ After Story, is definitely a must-see. It brings the show to a whole new level, tragic and moving.Of course you should watch the first season before After Story.
if you love romance with harem...you`re looking at the right page

A few years ago I tried watching the first episode and thought the animation wasn`t that good so I wasn`t gonna finish it. Skip to 2010 and I decide to watch it, it hooked me. Everything from the music to the characters to the storyline was so damn awesome. BTW, Dango Daikazoku is my lullaby.

Clannad is by far one of the best animes when it comes regarding life. relationships.The character are very well developed and the soundtrack is by far breathtaking This anime went to my top with Fuko arc, i cried so much.Give it a try, if you are a fan of this gender you will not regret ever watching it
Clannad had done a superb job being funny and enjoyable throughout the series without losing focus on its storyline. The best anime of its kind
Masterpiece. It makes you laugh in one second, and it makes you shiver of anxiety the second after.
You will laugh, cry, cheer, never regret watching this and won`t ever forget it. Just complete.
It`s not that good but you must watch it in order to watch its sequel because it`s the best anime in the world
best anime ever

I cant recommend this anime enough, my favourite of all time and I`ve seen alot. Its just just a fact of "If you want to", this is a "MUST SEE", and definately in the original Japanese, the dub doesnt do it justice. Best for story, soundtrack, plot, artwork and anything you can imagine. Sure with both seasons 52 episodes is alot but trust me, you`ll be crying half-way through!

I watched Angel Beats! and was searching for other animes made by the same people because it was so good. I found this series and other Key titles and have watched them all. I am proud to say this series (Clannad and After Story) is by far my favorite anime of all time. It has everything, except ecchi, that a perfect story need. It has romance, comedy, some action, character progression, and tragedy. I make a point to watch this anime every few months just because nothing really compares to it, and that`s saying a lot as I`ve seen a ton of shows. I`ve played the game(waiting on Tomoyo After to be translated) and this is honestly one of the best animes based off of a visual novel. You will not regret watching this anime. So sit down, grab your girlfriend/wife, and show her what a real romance is and stop watching those cheesy movies that they all drag you to.
+98%: story, character-2%: needs more ecchinessMasterpiece.
yust watch the best

Heh. This one was on my HDD for years since I was avoiding it... it`s just another show on my list where I am regretting that I haven`t watched it sooner. It`s a great comedy with likeable chars and touching moments.Though, I have to say that I enjoyed one of the specials the most (Another World, Tomoyo Chapter).
One of my favorites. I recommend watching "after story" right after, otherwise impression won`t be complete. And playing the VN beforehand.

Exceptional, daring, and bold are just some of the words to define the Clannad experience. For a series to possess virtually everything except mechas, and tell it in a manner which draws in anybody who has seen it can only be the work of legends. It has been my and many people`s experience that after viewing Clannad, you will be completely engulfed and desiring more. Miss this series, and you will undoubtedly regret it.
the only anime to ever make me cry, seriously cry, and then bring me right back to a full smile. Bravo, absolutely watch this, beginning to ending.
They`ve rewritten the path of Comedy/Romance
As expected, another great product of Kyoto animation.
Beautiful, nice story, so many feelings inside, a must see!
The story behind this show is so well done. Definitely a must see.
one of the best series i ever seen.
One of the best.I realy loved it ,so i highly recommend.The second season is ohh how should i put it BRILIANT :D
EPIC!!!

Superb animation after Kanon 2006! It is either this will be my no.1 or Kanon 2006 will be my no.1!! CLANNAD is a must must must watch anime of the year! It rocks! Story the best! Characters the best!
This anime make me addicted , OMG if this continue to season 3 (i hope) , i will going to blast....
great laugh, you will cry...

Definetely great, but not as good as the sequel.
Still a MUST SEE.
Overwhelmingly awesome. It truly was a roller coaster ride watching this anime. It goes without saying that you must watch the second season with it (preferably in the one session).
This is one of the best animes ever along with its sequel. Very emotional, very funny at times and nice romance plot. Characters are all adorable. This is by all means a MUST SEE.
Highly recommended. It`s sequel is definitely MUST SEE type, and more enjoyable if you know the background. Therefore I will rank this one as MUST SEE as well.
This is one of the best anime out there, and I have seen quite a few.
It`s really weird how this can be so funny and at the same time so touching. This is not only for school romance genre lovers, but for everyone.Also girls were über cute in this series.
Just must see for everyone
For anyone that can easily enjoy a high-school-slice-of-life. Has pretty good comedy value within it. But there`s more to this show than just comedy. And with an amazing sequel!
A Must-See All The Way! By the end, u`ll might even get a tear in ur eye like me
It`s very good, and what make`s it even better is the sequel... at the very least, watch this so you can watch one of the best Drama`s in history : Clannad After Story
You HAVE to watch this.Great animation, awesomes characters development and story, lots of fun and tears.
i don`t cry, my wife was looking at me like a moron cuz she don`t watch anime and she`s never seen me cry and i was straight up crying. So emotional and definitely worth watching

A good anime to watch as a starter, this was probably the 2nd anime I watched and I loved it. If you are hooked in the first two minutes like me then you`ll more than likely love it. Little to no ecchi scenes which is a huge plus. Overall a good anime to watch that involves school and drama involving each girls arc.

anime.description: * Adaptation of the renowned visual novel by http://anidb.net/cr1046 [Visual Art`s/Key].Set in a high school located in some Japanese town. http://anidb.net/ch1113 [Okazaki Tomoya] is a third-year student who does not take his studies seriously. Always late for class, he is seen as a delinquent by the rest of his classmates who are busy preparing for their college entrance examinations. Needless to say, he does not have too many close friends either.Tomoya does not seem to mind though — until one day he meets a girl, http://anidb.net/ch1116 [Furukawa Nagisa], who is left alone without friends at school because everybody she knew already graduated. "What a clumsy girl", he thinks at first. But talking to her feels natural and so, while helping her, he meets a few other girls from his school. Although he does not care much about them at first, he soon opens his heart to them as they get to know each other better.

category.name: Slapstick
category.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

category.name: Japan
category.description: Last stronghold for humanity, if Tokyo falls, it`s all over. Tokyo Tower will undoubtedly fall anyway.

category.name: Present
category.description: Somewhere between past and future

category.name: High School
category.description:
The upper-secondary education (not compulsory in Japan) covers the grades ten, eleven, and twelve. The students are typically fifteen to eighteen years old.
Anime centre on High School settings predominately: Plot/story-wise the coming of age is of interest - the students are almost adults (their bodies have matured, see ecchi anime) with more earnest, real-life problems.

category.name: Dating Sim - Visual Novel
category.description: The two terms are similar yet different, however, the fact that they look and `feel` the same outweighs the technical differences. For clarification, visual novels are considered a sub-genre of adventure games and the term does not cover simulations. While the two genres often share a common visual presentation, dating sims are sometimes considered to be more statistically based than the "choose your own adventure" style of visual novels; basically, the choices you make might change something else than just the story arc (or your next porn pic). Dating sims can involve several technical elements such as a time limit, several statistics such as looks and charm which can be boosted through exercise, or an "attraction meter" which can increase or decrease depending on one`s decisions.

category.name: Comedy
category.description:
Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience.
Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

category.name: School Life
category.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

category.name: Daily Life
category.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

category.name: Game
category.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

category.name: Angst
category.description:
A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression.
Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing.

category.name: Harem
category.description: Three or more characters, generally female, are under the influence of one character, normally male. Their interactions are romantically or sexually loaded. The female characters often draw heavily from stock archetypes. Sexual tones are applied to the lead`s behavior and to the members` depiction. The lead will often be physically abused for his behavior. The harem may be only a support to an existing or predictable relationship, or the lead may end up in relationships with most or all members.

category.name: Clubs
category.description:
Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs.
As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

category.name: Asia
category.description: Asia is the world`s largest and most populous continent.

category.name: Earth
category.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun. It is a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). To its inhabitants, our planet is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. The Earth is the main setting of most fiction, but many titles are set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, and in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by invaders.

category.name: Romance
category.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

category.name: Stereotypes
category.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

category.name: Love Polygon
category.description: A love polygon refers to a romantic relationship involving n people. Although a love triangle is not limited to just heterosexual relationships, in anime, it usually deals with two females liking one male and vice versa.

category.name: Plot Continuity
category.description:
Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer.
A single linear focused plot is highly continuous.
A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

category.name: Seinen
category.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word seinen refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 15 and 44. In Japanese, the word means simply "young man", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

category.name: Violence
category.description: Physical force against self or other, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt.

category.name: Delinquents
category.description:
Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding:
* The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

category.name: Parallel Universe
category.description: Parallel universe/world or alternative reality is a self-contained separate reality coexisting with our own. Because "alternative reality" sometimes implies that the reality is a variant of our own, like for example a mirror world, we`ll use the term "Parallel Universe" which is more general, without any connotations implying a relationship (or lack thereof) with our own universe (meaning a fantasy world can just as well have an alternative reality, doesn`t need to be our reality). To put it more simply, this category is to show if more than 1 universe/reality/world is present in the anime.

category.name: Fantasy World
category.description: A fantasy world is a type of imaginary world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to magic or magical abilities and a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography and sociology, and also on folklore.

category.name: Performance
category.description: The song performance on stage or acting in a theatre is a central part of the character`s life in this anime type.

category.name: Contemporary Fantasy
category.description: Magic and supernatural beings exist secretly in what is generally regarded as the real world. Such elements may have originated from another world. Stories where a modern-day character travels to an alternate fantasy world are not considered contemporary fantasy.

category.name: Tragedy
category.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

category.name: School Festival
category.description: The obligatory school festival (or cultural fair) with cosplay cafe, haunted house, theatre performance, and food booths cannot be missing in any school setting.For good measure there may also be an athletics or sports festival in this anime.

category.name: Zettai Ryouiki
category.description: Japanese for "absolute area", and refers to an area of bare skin on the legs between a skirt and knee- or thigh-high stockings.

category.name: Parental Abandonment
category.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier.

category.name: Lethal Cooking
category.description: Some characters, most often than not the otherwise perfect beauty out of the main character`s harem, simply do not have any skills for cooking. Not only does anything they do turn out dangerously bad for anyone who dares to taste it, they also seem to ignite anything they try to cook, even when there is no fire or heat involved.A common element in anime which most often comes together with a cooking episode where other characters try to teach said character much needed skills to cook. Needless to say, it usually fails.

category.name: Slow When It Comes to Love
category.description:
The main protagonists in this anime have a very hard time trying to express their feelings to each other. They simply will not finally confess their love.
In some cases this romance element is based on unrequited love, or an absurd amount of shyness.

category.name: Friendship
category.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: girly tears
tag.description: Usually girly tears are the ones not shed by men (duh). Like when a (stereotypical) girl watches something and cries her makeup out, a (stereotypical) dude just says, proclaiming his masculinity: "Meh, yet another soap opera bulls..t, I`ll be in my garage fixing my ride while playing heavy metal on a burning guitar ...with my teeth! And where`s my beer, woman?".So that`s how it goes: girly tears are for girls and sissies! Chuck Norris forbid a guy would weep watching something that has this tag! Now 20 push-ups!P.S. The opposite of "manly tears". Or is it? Let`s face it - it`s all subjective (and relative, and context-dependent).

tag.name: emotionally engaging style
tag.description: The style in this anime "touches the heart" by using nice sunny settings, beautiful nature views, e.g. sakura trees, and the camera shots are all slightly misted, giving the scenes a level of softness. To complete the picture the story is heart-wrenching and tear-jerking.

tag.name: real-world location
tag.description: Places seen in the show exist in reality.Note: This could be sometime in the future, though names and certain places will still be recognizable.

tag.name: sibling yin yang
tag.description: In real life, siblings hardly ever act the same. Fiction sometimes takes this to an extreme.Enter Sibling Yin Yang, the occurrence of siblings that are nearly polar opposites. If he`s cool and reckless, she`s responsible and thoughtful. If she`s a spiky-haired hooligan, he`s the nerdy wimpy one. If he`s an immature brat, she`s... well, you get the picture.

tag.name: happily ever after
tag.description: And they lived "happily ever after"... *sniff*.All issues in the anime have been resolved, the love polygons sorted out, the conflicts resolved, the guy gets the girl (or the other way around), and everyone else lives on blissfully.(Not very realistic, but then again this is anime.)

tag.name: tsundere
tag.description: A character type (usually female), who is often easily agitated or combative, but other times is quite kind and caring, especially in situations involving a person they are (knowingly or unknowingly) attracted to.

tag.name: boy meets girl
tag.description: A classical type of plot in story writing, where the story begins with a boy meeting a girl leading to romantic development between the two. More often than not the boy loses the girl later on and has to find her again.

tag.name: awesome dad
tag.description: Features one or more of the characters having father`s which exceed certain criteria to the point of inspiring a sense of awe and wonder in the viewer, whether through their extremely relaxed and open-minded nature towards sexuality/romantic conquests (specifically in relation to their offspring), or their extreme levels of fighting spirit and sense of justice (again usually in relation to their offspring).

tag.name: dango family
tag.description: Dango, dango, dango ...

tag.name: great OP and ED
tag.description: The OP (opening) and ED (ending) sequences contain a strong sense of effort toward impressively utilizing visuals, instrumentals and vocals to captivate an audience.This has nothing to do with any karaoke effects and styling individual subbers may have added.

tag.name: unrequited love
tag.description: At least one character has a romantic interest in another one, but the feelings are not returned. This is the cornerstone of all love triangles or love polygons.

tag.name: family
tag.description: Yourself, your mate, your siblings, your parents, their parents, your mate`s parents, your children, your siblings children, your children`s children and so on.

tag.name: awesome bread
tag.description: The bread in this anime is noteworthy in some way, and may even have special properties. All this takes place in a bakery setting, probably.

tag.name: great voice acting
tag.description: The seiyū (voice actors) have done a great job with their talented voices. They breathe life into the character they represent as though expressing their very selves through their animated counter-part.

tag.name: awesome storyline
tag.description: The storyline is intriguingly crafted: The suspense will keep you at the edge of your seat, the plot twists will very much surprise, the character development is both convincing, and entertaining.This is how anime should be!

tag.name: instant fan club
tag.description: A character is considered so awesome that not only do they have notable admirers, but their fans become organized in such a fashion to have a following that could only be guaranteed in real life by precise and long increments of paparazzi-like stalking.If the character is sufficiently cool this may happen practically overnight (i.e., within a few episodes of them being introduced), although the subject of admiration typically has mixed feelings about the entire affair.

tag.name: spacing out
tag.description: A comedy element: The character starts to daydream or fantasize about some topic. The typical complete lack of reality makes the spacing out funny. Especially when the protagonist mumbles to himself / herself and friends hear this. Promptly teasing the possibly lovestruck and very embarrassed protagonist.

tag.name: dango
tag.description: Japanese (sweet) dumplings made from rice flour (often in the form of pink, white, and green spheroids on a stick).

tag.name: loneliness
tag.description: Loneliness is an unpleasant feeling in which a person feels a strong sense of emptiness and solitude resulting from inadequate levels of social relationships. However, it is a subjective experience. Loneliness has also been described as social pain — a psychological mechanism meant to alert an individual of isolation and motivate her/him to seek social connections.(Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: delayed 16-9 broadcast
tag.description: This anime was created with an aspect ratio of 16:9 (widescreen), but its initial Japanese TV broadcasts were cropped to 4:3 (fullscreen). At some point (usually 2-4 weeks) down the line, it was rebroadcast in 16:9.Note: This tag does NOT apply to series created in 16:9, but only broadcast in 4:3 and not made available in 16:9 until their DVD/BD release. For those, use "Broadcast cropped to 4-3".

tag.name: awesome main character
tag.description: The show`s main characters deserve to be held in awe — this could be for many reasons including but not limited to ability, personality, strength of character.Which is good. I mean who wants angst ridden brats for main characters these days anyway?

tag.name: illness
tag.description: It could be life threatening, debilitating or just an annoyance, but one character in this anime has a disease that affects not only them but those around them.Friends and family may need to help the character perform day to day activities, or nurse them round the clock.Sometimes the character recovers, sometimes not.The attitude of the character to their illness can be inspiring or galling to the viewer... some characters rise above their illness, but others use it as an excuse to do whatever they want and take advantage of others.And then there are the hypochondriacs...

tag.name: melodramatic
tag.description: The anime is saturated with overly emphasized emotions and events, exaggerating even the most trivial happenings.Typical of what you could call "drivel".

tag.name: makes you laugh and cry
tag.description: While watching this series you can expect moments when you fall off your chair laughing, and moments when you will be thankful that there is a pack of tissues nearby. It`s worth mentioning that tears can be caused by touching/drama moments (e.g. Clannad, Hanada Shounen Shi) or "mighty"/overwhelming moments (Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann).

tag.name: manly tears
tag.description: Somewhere down the line, it became the "norm" that boys don`t cry. The scenario does not matter; shedding tears is the ultimate no-no in terms of what you can and cannot do as a man (at least in the West, anyway). But there comes a time when a man`s emotions do get the better of him, and they pour forth - as prerequisite an impassioned speech may or may not be present - by cascading down his cheeks. These are what we like to call "manly tears". Extremely powerful. Not limited but often used in hot-blooded / super robot shows. Examples include Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar, Getter Robo and Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann.The opposite of manly tears are "girly tears".

tag.name: Paradise Lost
tag.description: Derived from the Biblical story of the Fall of Man: the temptation of Adam and Eve by the fallen angel Satan and their expulsion from the Garden of Eden.This tag is used to demonstrate the unbearable loss, the feeling of losing everything along with every single bit of happiness. It prerequisites a small peaceful period of happiness. The main reason for losing "his/her paradise" can either be the death/sacrifice of an important character or even a betrayal. Usually the anime loses a lot of its former glory afterwards.

tag.name: starfish
tag.description: An actual starfish, or something in the shape thereof is important to the characters in this anime.Definition: Starfish or sea stars are echinoderms belonging to the class Asteroidea. The names "starfish" and "sea star" essentially refer to members of the class Asteroidea. However, common usage frequently finds "starfish" and "sea star" also applied to ophiuroids which are correctly referred to as "brittle stars" or "basket stars". There are about 1,800 living species of starfish that occur in all the world`s oceans, including the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian as well as in the Arctic and the Southern Ocean (i.e., Antarctic) regions. Starfish occur across a broad depth range from the intertidal to abyssal depths (>6000 m).(Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: tear jerker
tag.description: Parts of the anime are so emotionally moving or sad that they bring tears to your eyes.

tag.name: piggyback ride
tag.description: One of the protagonists (usually male) gives another character (usually female) a ride on the back. Can be interpreted as a sign of closeness or endearment in a romance setting.Reasons: The female character is exhausted from previous running, or has a fit of anaemia, or hurt herself and no longer can walk.

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: ghost girl
tag.description: The anime in question has one or more female ghost or ghost-like creatures in it. Ghost girls are often found in anime with a darker theme or in special episodes that are meant to be scary, this is however not always the case, since it is not uncommon for a ghost to be a comical character or just a cute sidekick.

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package.The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: awesome animation
tag.description: Describes the style of an animation production that deems itself respectfully noteworthy for its impressive uniqueness of appearance and attention, emphasis, or exaggeration to all or specific characteristics, constructions and details that make it so recognizable.

tag.name: supernatural
tag.description: Things happen in this anime that seem to be beyond nature or physical laws.Examples: Ghosts, vampires, monsters, telepathy, telekinesis, etc.

tag.name: twins
tag.description: Twin siblings featured in the cast.

tag.name: sakura
tag.description: Sakura is the Japanese name for cherry trees, and their blossoms.Sakura is an omen of good fortune and is also an emblem of love, affection and represents spring. Cherry blossoms are richly symbolic, they are an enduring metaphor for the fleeting nature of life, and as such are frequently depicted Japanese art, manga, anime, and film.Sakura are object of the Japanese traditional custom of Hanami or Flower viewing.

tag.name: slow-paced
tag.description: The story — including its characters and events — develop slowly.May contain a weak continuity of plot and/or character development. Or may be a story telling device to increase the "sense of foreboding" in an anime with thriller or horror setting.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly female cast, i.e. male characters are rare.Example: A Catholic all-girls school setting.

tag.name: overly cute catchphrase
tag.description: Mostly a sound or neologism used by characters to make them look cute or `moe` to the viewer. Examples would be Misuzu`s `gao` in AIR, Sakura`s `hoe` in Card Captor Sakura, Suiseiseki`s `desu` in Rozen Maiden or Ayu`s `uguu` in Kanon (as well as several other characters in the same show).

tag.name: maturing character
tag.description: One of the character grows mature along the events shown in this anime. The process may be mental and/or physical.

tag.name: helpful couple
tag.description: This is a very low key type of romance in which the main two characters spend a great deal of time hanging out together just helping other people solve problems. The couple`s personal interaction tends to be subtle.

tag.name: hopeless secondary character
tag.description: You know that guy that`s the best friend - in his own mind at least - of the male lead; the one who is hopelessly in love with one or more of the ladies and keeps tripping over himself trying to get her attention - this is him. No matter what he does, she`s never going to look at him "that way", although she may, and probably does, use him for her own devices. Think Yamada from "Sister Princess" or Hatano from "Lamune".

tag.name: comic relief animal sidekick
tag.description: Every mahou shoujo anime needs them, the cute little critters that are supposed to help the protagonists but in reality are nothing but useless bystanders most often abused for gags. Kids love them but they can also often turn into an annoyance.

tag.name: childhood friend
tag.description: Plot device: The usually main protagonist encounters or “lives with” a friend from childhood times. By default they have a very close relationship that usually interferers with other present-day relations. Typical scenarios: Male protagonist has been looked after by the female childhood friend ever since they were kids, representing the default “girlfriend” in a harem anime. Or the childhood friend has been away in some other city or foreign country and suddenly returns surprising the main protagonist, who had almost forgotten about this friend (as in “Sudden Girlfriend Appearance”). In the latter case, protagonist and friend may be bound by some unreasonable “childhood promise”.

tag.name: moe
tag.description: Moe refers to characters (most often female) whose cute, innocent mannerisms and flaws, such as clumsiness or insecurity, result in a strong response of adoration and protectiveness from the viewer. Moe characters may be considered sexy by viewers, though that is not a requirement per se.

tag.name: eternal blush
tag.description: It is no ordinary blush it is a blush that does not disappear.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: These anime have a male protagonist.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: amnesia
tag.description: Loss of memory.Used as story element, gradually revealing a protagonist`s past that had been forgotten. Usually revealing a terribly gruesome happening.

tag.name: awesome comedy duo
tag.description: A pair of strongly contrasting characters with incredibly quick and witty dialogues bring about much hilarity.

character.name: Okazaki Tomoya
character.description: Tomoya is the male protagonist of Clannad. Due to his habit of always arriving late to school, skipping classes during the day, and staying out all night, he has been labeled as a delinquent, or a young person who defies authority. Ever since his mother, Atsuko, died in a car accident when he was young, Tomoya has been living with his father, Naoyuki, with whom he argues constantly. Tomoya was injured during a fight with his father three years ago; since then, their relationship has been very distant. While walking to school, Tomoya met Nagisa Furukawa, since then, his life changed. Nagisa describes him as someone who is mean and bad-mouthed, but actually kind-hearted.

character.name: Furukawa Nagisa
character.description: Nagisa is the main heroine of Clannad. Although she is in her third year in high school, as is Tomoya, Nagisa is actually one year older since she had to repeat her third year after an illness that lasted nine months. On the first day of school, She meets Tomoya on a long hill path in front of the school. She has a strange habit of muttering the names of food that she plans to eat as a way to motivate herself, such as anpan. She wants to re-establish the once-disbanded drama club. She does not have much self-confidence so she often needs help in order to motivate herself through the day.

character.name: Fujibayashi Kyou
character.description: Kyou is a bad-mouthed and aggressive girl who is also well known as a good cook. She is the older of the Fujibayashi twins. She was in Tomoya`s class in their second year, and has maintained a steady friendship with Tomoya even though they are put in different classes on their third year. She is currently the class representative of her class. She has a pet baby boar named Botan. She even has her own motorbike (in this case a scooter), which is known only to Tomoya and her sister, as Kyou does not want the news of her possession of it to be known, as she fears suspension from school because she is not allowed to ride a motorbike to school. Her favourite weapon is various types of dictionaries, which are thrown at anyone she gets furious with, typically Youhei. In the anime, Kyou uses various books as weapons more often, and while Tomoya almost always avoids them, Youhei gets hit almost every single time.

character.name: Ichinose Kotomi
character.description: Kotomi is another schoolmate of Tomoya`s in the same year, but, like Kyou, is in a separate class from Tomoya. The "Koto" in Kotomi is derived from the Japanese musical stringed instrument of the same name. She is in the top ten for every subject throughout the whole country in standardized exam results — she always goes to library to read extra materials, especially books in foreign languages. Kotomi is a very quiet girl and it is quite difficult to communicate with her. In her spare time, she plays the violin, although she is very poor at it to the point of causing pain to those who hear her play.

character.name: Sakagami Tomoyo
character.description: Tomoyo transferred to Tomoya`s school as a second year student during spring. Although Tomoya is older than her, Tomoyo does not show him his due respect as a senior student.

character.name: Ibuki Fuuko
character.description: A first year student at Tomoya`s school. She is always alone, making wood carvings of starfish with a small knife to give to others as presents. This hobby completely drains her concentration and awareness of her surroundings.

character.name: Fujibayashi Ryou
character.description: Ryou is Tomoya`s classmate and class representative. She is the younger of the Fujibayashi twins. Unlike her older sister, she is timid and doesn`t cook well. Ryou is very keen about fortune telling, but her predictions, while incredibly specific, always manage to be either somewhat skewed or extremely wrong.

character.name: Sagara Misae
character.description: Misae Sagara is the resident manager at Youhei`s dorm. She was a student council president when she was in high school. Misae is friendly with the dorm students but strict when it comes to the dorm rules. She is also well-liked by the rugby members. Depending on decisions, Tomoya can change her to a violent dorm lady through his lecture, which is her original personality, who uses brute force to convince the dorm students to do their cleaning duty.

character.name: Sunohara Mei
character.description: Youhei`s younger sister who loves Youhei as a brother and lives in the countryside. Mei is a smart girl and likes to see new things. She is a fan of Yoshino Yuusuke, an older male graduate from Tomoya`s school, who is a member of a band. Worried about her brother`s situation, she calls Youhei, but instead of her brother, Tomoya disguised as Youhei tells her to come.

character.name: Furukawa Sanae
character.description: Sanae is Nagisa`s mother. Normally she`s very childish and a cry-baby, but when needed she can be very strong-willed and dependable. She runs the Furukawa Bakery with her husband Akio. She often tries out strange concepts to make breads that are anything but edible and never get sold. Outside of the bakery, she tutors children. She`s quite proud of the way people often mistaken her as Nagisa`s older sister because of her youthful appearance. When Akio accidentally makes Sanae cry because of his accidental bad remarks on her bread, he will have to chase after her with her bread stuffed into his mouth, to calm her down, or else she will run around the town crying.

character.name: Ibuki Kouko
character.description: Fuuko`s older sister. She used to be an art teacher at Tomoya`s school, and she treats everyone kindly. Kouko is one of the familiar faces in the Furukawa Bakery, and Nagisa admires her very much. Currently she is engaged with Yoshino Yuusuke, and is the major reason why Fuuko still exists in the school, despite still sleeping in the hospital.

character.name: Sunohara Youhei
character.description: Tomoya`s friend and also a delinquent. He entered the school on an athletic recommendation in football, but was kicked out of the football club after being involved in a fight. After this incident, he became lazy, becoming the only student with a higher absence rate than Tomoya. He and Tomoya are known as the "Dirty Pair" in school. He has a sister named Mei. Youhei is basically a comic relief character, and his most notable punishment he receives includes him getting bullied and attacked by Tomoya and Kyou, beaten to a pulp by Tomoyo for trying to assault her, and getting attacked by the Rugby Team Members for various unfortunate events involving them.

character.name: Miyazawa Yukine
character.description: Yukine is a second year student who hangs around in the library`s reference room during lunchtime. Tomoya first met her in the library`s reference room while trying to find a place to sleep. He is immediately greeted by her hospitality, and returns the next day with Youhei due to Youhei`s insistent. Ever since, Tomoya and Youhei start to enter the library reference room routinely. She later avails Tomoya and Youhei an instruction book for magical spells for them to try. Most of them are in the favor of Tomoya, involving the girls they met.She has friends outside of her school, which turns out to be delinquents from other schools. She made friends with the delinquents through her brother, Kazuto, who is also a delinquent, after his death trying to save a friend from an accident. She sees Tomoya as her older brother, who has a similar personality as her dead brother. Tomoya learns briefly about the light orbs through Yukine, which are called the symbol of happiness. The light orbs are actually the people`s feelings inside the city Tomoya is staying.According to the script writers, Yukine was originally intended to be one of the heroines of Clannad, but as her story did not reach their expectations, she was made into a secondary character. However, she was still depicted on the regular edition cover of the PC release, and on the PlayStation 2 release which used the same art as the regular PC release.

character.name: Furukawa Akio
character.description: Nagisa`s father. Although he often talks and plays rough, he is kind and sympathetic. His childish side makes it easy for people to befriend him. He runs the Furukawa Bakery with his wife Sanae. In his spare time, Akio plays baseball with children in the small park next to the bakery, and indulges in the Gundam fandom. He is often the victim of Sanae`s bread, especially when Sanae runs around the town crying due to his accidental bad remark about her bread, and always have to eat her bread in front of her to calm Sanae down.

character.name: Yoshino Yuusuke
character.description: An electrician who once attended Tomoya`s high school and lived as a rock musician. He is admired by Mei for his infrequent rock play. Tomoya first met Yuusuke during a street light accident involving a person`s car, but was actually a cat that cause the dent on the car. Tomoya assists Yuusuke in his work, and after working Tomoya is tired, realizes the pain of working in society. He is engaged to Kouko, and is also one of the reason why Fuuko exists in the school.

character.name: Kunisaki Yukito
character.description: Yukito is a wanderer travelling across the country in order to find the `girl in the sky`, a goal each generation of his family has passed on for a thousand years. Yukito lives off his trade, a special form of stringless puppeteering that was taught to him by his mother before she died.

character.name: Botan
character.description: Botan is Kyou`s pet baby boar, and is a comic relief character. Botan will sometimes go to Kyou`s school just to see her. Due to its small size and the fact that it is a baby boar, it is sometimes captured by several characters who talk of eating it. Botan hates Ryou because it mistook Ryou for trying to eat it when she took it for a warm bath. In the After Story, Botan has become an adult boar, but still acts the same. Botan has seven different skills, told him by Kyou, one of them being able to take the appearance of a stuffed animal by being extremely still. Another skill is called "Rugby Ball" in which Botan shrinks his legs until he resembles a ball, allowing Kyou to use him as a projectile. These skills are considered to be animal cruelty by Tomoya. Two other skills are mentioned in the visual novel, but never shown, called "massager" and "pillow".

character.name: Sugisaka
character.description: Sugisaka is a member of the chorus club. She tries to force Nagisa to give up on establishing theatre club by threatening her, but later confronts Nagisa directly, telling Rie`s past, hoping she will not bother Rie`s dream. Youhei does not trust Sugisaka due to her usage of threat letter, and her attempt on messing up Nagisa`s shoe cabinet. In the After Story anime, Sugisaka works as a waitress in the same family restaurant as Nagisa.

character.name: Boku no Koe
character.description: He has no name, but narrates the situation in the illusionary world seen through Tomoya`s dream while referring to himself only as "Me" (boku). He had his body created by the girl out of garbage so that he can be with her. The body is about half the girl`s height. He can`t talk as he is created without a mouth, so relies on body language to communicate with the girl. This is Tomoya himself after his death. Ushio in the edge of death in the illusion told him to collect light orbs to create a miracle to save Nagisa, Ushio and himself from tragedy.

character.name: Shoujo
character.description: The only human in the illusionary world, a world Tomoya dreams of. She creates a body out of garbage for an unnamed entity only referred to as "Me," so that she will not be alone in the illusionary world. This is Ushio after her death, who had lost her memories. In her edge of death after failing to get away from the illusionary world, Ushio, who had regained her memories, called the garbage doll (Tomoya) to collect the light orbs in order to save themselves for their doomed tragedy. In Clannad`s epilogue, she is shown sleeping under a tree where Akio begged for Nagisa`s life.

character.name: Okazaki Naoyuki
character.description: Naoyuki is Tomoya`s father. Tomoya`s mother, Atsuko, died when Tomoya was young, thus leaving only himself to raise Tomoya. After the accident, Naoyuki turned to alcohol and smoking, and held frequent fights with his son. One day while arguing with his son on trivial things, he slammed Tomoya against the wall, dislocating Tomoya`s right shoulder. Immediately after that, Tomoya refused to come out of his room, and by the time he finally went to the hospital, it was declared to be untreatable. Ever since then, his father has treated Tomoya more kindly, but like a stranger rather than family. This only hurt Tomoya even more, so he becomes a delinquent, as he is unable to participate in basketball activities any longer, and he avoided returning to his home early enough to be confronted with his father. Tomoya has the intention of running away from his home, as revealed from Kotomi`s path.As revealed from Shino`s story about Naoyuki, even though his wife died and he had become depressed, Naoyuki sacrificed everything in his life just for Tomoya`s sake, hoping Tomoya to grow up to be a proper man unlike him. After Tomoya comes to terms with his father, Naoyuki decides to return to his hometown to stay with his mother, claiming his role as a father has finally come to an end.In the movie, Naoyuki works a graveyard shift instead of staying home and becoming a drunk. He also cares about his relationship with Tomoya and even tries to ease his son`s depression in order prevent his son from becoming like him.

character.name: Nishina Rie
character.description: Rie is a member of the chorus club. She used to be a talented violin player, entered a lot of concerts, but had to quit her violin career after an accident. She almost gave up her life when Koumura confronts her and teaches her chorus. Thus, Rie regained her meaning of her life, and wants to create the chorus club. In Kotomi`s path, she lends Kotomi a violin. In After Story, Rie works as a waitress in the same family restaurant as Nagisa.

character.name: Mitsui
character.description: Mitsui is Fuuko`s first friend before Fuuko`s accident. Although Mitsui still remembers Fuuko, she acts coldly towards her, refusing Fuuko`s invitation to her sister`s wedding, as she is more concerned about her third year exams. Tomoya depicts her as a disgusting class representative because of her treatment towards Fuuko. Out of a miracle, she appeared in her sister`s wedding.

character.name: Koumura Toshio
character.description: Koumura Toshio is a language teacher at Tomoya`s school and Tomoya`s home room teacher during his first year. His age conceals his once vigorous past marked by his enthusiasm in teaching. He taught Ibuki Kouko many years ago.Five years ago, he was a strict teacher in an engineering school being well known for delinquents. He changed a lot of delinquents in the engineering school for the better, but at Tomoya`s school, his skill is not needed due to the prestigious image of the school. He finds Tomoya and Youhei to be odd ones and decides to change them for the better; he is the one who arranged Tomoya and Youhei to meet.He retires one year later, prior to the end of the school segment of the story. In After Story, he returns and organizes the fake graduating ceremony intended for Nagisa, arranged by Tomoya.

character.name: Harada
character.description: Harada is a member of the chorus club.

character.name: Isogai
character.description: Isogai is an old lady who lives next door to the Furukawa bakery. She often sees Akio and Sanae running out of the store, and remarks on how the neighborhood finds it entertaining because of the two.

character.name: Shinshi
character.description: Colleague of Ichinose`s.

character.name: Ichinose Mizue
character.description: Kotomi`s mother.

character.name: Ichinose Koutarou
character.description: Kotomi`s father.

character.name: Kurofuku no Otoko
character.description: Suspicious man in black clothes.

character.name: Seitokai Yakuin (Ni-Nen)
character.description: Student council officer, second year.

character.name: Nanashi
character.description: Misae`s cat with no name.

character.name: Sakagami Takafumi
character.description: Sakagami Takafumi is Tomoyo`s little brother.

character.name: Kanako
character.description: She is Takafumi`s Ex-girlfriend in http://vndb.org/v12 [Tomoyo After]

episode.title: 桜舞い散る坂道で
On the Hillside Path Where the Cherry Blossoms Flutter
Sakura Mai Chiru Sakamichi de
涙のあとにもう一度
Once Again After the Tears
Namida no Ato ni Mou Ichido
姉と妹の創立者祭
The Older and Younger Sister`s Founder`s Festival
Ane to Imouto no Souritsu Shasai
黄昏に消える風
The Wind That Vanishes into Dusk
Tasogare ni Kieru Kaze
夢の最後まで
Until the End of the Dream
Yume no Saigo made
セオリー オブ エヴリシング
Theory of Everything
Theory of Everything
もうひとつの世界, 智代編
Another World: Tomoyo Chapter
Mou Hitotsu no Sekai, Tomoyo Hen
Mou Hitotsu no Sekai Tomoyo-hen - Blu-ray BOX Eizou Tokuten
Promotion Clip 2 - Blu-ray BOX Eizou Tokuten
Promotion Clip 1 - Blu-ray BOX Eizou Tokuten
